description: From French havresac, from Low German Haaversack and/or German Habersack, Hafersack (literally “oat-sack”), from Hafer + Sack. Compare also Dutch haverzak.

entries.meaning: A small, strong bag carried on the back or the shoulder, usually with only one strap, and originally made of canvas.
(archaic) An oat-sack, or nosebag for a horse.
